title: Data Centers are Powering Blackstone $1 . 3 Trillion Investment Engine :
description:
# Data Centers are Powering Blackstone’s $1.3 Trillion Investment Engine:

[January 30, 2026](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/01/2026/data-centers-are-powering-blackstones-1-3-trillion-investment-engine.
content:
# Data Centers are Powering Blackstone’s $1.3 Trillion Investment Engine:

[January 30, 2026](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/01/2026/data-centers-are-powering-blackstones-1-3-trillion-investment-engine.html "12:31 am") : [Permanent Link](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/01/2026/meta-prep%20meta-prep-author)

[![](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/unnamed-323.jpg)](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/unnamed-323.jpg)

(HedgeCo.Net) In reporting fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results on **January 29, 2026**, Blackstone highlighted **$71.5 billion of inflows in the quarter** (its highest in more than three years) and **$239.4 billion for the year**, pushing **total AUM to $1.2749 trillion**. The numbers confirm that, while investors still debate the durability of private markets in a “higher-for-longer” world, capital is continuing to consolidate with the biggest platforms—especially those that can deploy at scale into secular-growth infrastructure and generate realizations as exit markets reopen.

## The headline scorecard: fundraising momentum, earnings resilience, and $1.3 trillion scale:

[![](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/unnamed-324.jpg)](https://www.hedgeco.net/news/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/unnamed-324.jpg)

Blackstone’s release framed Q4 as the capstone to a record year. CEO Stephen Schwarzman said the firm “delivered again” for limited partners, pointing directly to the quarter’s inflow surge and the firm’s focus on “massive scale” investing in **digital and energy infrastructure**. That emphasis matters: it positions Blackstone not simply as a diversified alternatives manager, but as an institutional conduit for one of the largest capital buildouts of this decade.

Financially, Blackstone reported:

- **Fee Related Earnings (FRE): $1.5 billion in Q4 ($1.25/share); $5.7 billion for FY 2025 ($4.67/share)**
- **Distributable Earnings (DE): $2.2 billion in Q4 ($1.75/share); $7.1 billion for FY 202
